trial_identification.studytitle: Prospective database for the management of venous malformations at Sydney Children's Hospital
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Children with venous malformations who are seen at Sydney childrens hospital will have annual bloods to assess the risk of coagulopathy.

interventions.interventions: patients will have annual bloods for 5 years to assess coagulopathy (Full blood count, Platelets, plasma fibrinogen, D-dimer, Von Willebrand factor ). Blood willl be taken from direct venous access.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Deep vein thrombosis (DVT) This outcomes will be assessed annually through patient history and through the medical record data. DVT will be assessed using clinical imaging as appropriate for the condition.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Patients will be asked if they have experienced and symptoms in the past 12 months including infection, bleeding, pain, poor wound healing, visual compromise, and what treatment they have had in the past 12 months including compression garments, antibiotics as prophylaxis or treatment, sclerotherapy, surgery , laser or other treatment. Their medical records will also be reviewed.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Venous malformation seen at SCH Randwick

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Sydney Children's Hospital High Street Randwick NSW 2031

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Prospective data collection of details of venous malformations and blood screen for coagulopathy
